intro: Pedilanthus campester, commonly known as the yellow miracle or golden cup, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has elliptical, dark green leaves and produces a milky sap that is toxic to humans and animals. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is often cultivated in gardens and traditional medicine practices.
